detailed_translations.english: if rock, wood, or someone’s face is weathered by the wind, sun, rain etc, or if it weathers, it changes colour or shape over a period of time

sentences.english: the great traditions of ancient Greek drama
sentences.chinese: 古希腊戏剧的伟大传统

sentences.english: a new drama series for Saturday nights
sentences.chinese: 周六晚上播放的新连续剧

sentences.english: a drama critic
sentences.chinese: 戏剧评论员

sentences.english: a courtroom drama
sentences.chinese: 法庭剧

sentences.english: a lavish costume drama
sentences.chinese: 豪华古装剧

sentences.english: He plays a Russian spy in the comedy drama ‘Sleepers’.
sentences.chinese: 他在喜剧片《潜伏特工》中扮演一名俄罗斯间谍。

detailed_translations.chinese: 戏剧， 剧本； 戏剧性事件
detailed_translations.english: a play for the theatre, television, radio etc, usually a serious one, or plays in general

sentences.english: The boys were playing a game in the backyard.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们在后院里玩游戏。

sentences.english: game birds
sentences.chinese: 被捕猎的鸟

detailed_translations.english: an activity or sport in which people compete with each other according to agreed rules

sentences.english: the sport of falconry
sentences.chinese: 放鹰狩猎运动

sentences.english: a demonstration by people opposed to blood sports
sentences.chinese: 反对猎杀动物运动的人士举行的示威游行

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；游戏；娱乐；运动会；玩笑
detailed_translations.english: an activity that people do in the countryside, especially hunting or fishing
to play together happily

sentences.english: The set (x, y) has two members.
sentences.chinese: （x, y）这个集里有两个项。

detailed_translations.english: a group of numbers, shapes etc in mathematics

sentences.english: The new acting president has a reputation of being someone who is independent.
sentences.chinese: 这位新的临时代理总裁有极有主见的名声。

detailed_translations.english: You use acting before the title of a job to indicate that someone is doing that job temporarily
the job or skill of performing in plays and films

sentences.english: She replied to a lonely hearts ad she spotted in the New York Times.
sentences.chinese: 她回复了在《纽约时报》上看到的一则求友广告。

detailed_translations.english: an advertisement

sentences.english: a 50 mph speed restriction
sentences.chinese: 每小时50英里的限速

detailed_translations.english: a rule or law that limits or controls what people can do

name: rating
trans: (人或事物按品质﹑ 特性等划分的)等级, 级别

sentences.english: By the end of the year the Prime Minister’s approval rating (= how many people agreed with his policies ) had fallen as low as 12 percent.
sentences.chinese: 到年底时，首相的支持率跌到了12%的低点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 等级；等级评定；额定功率
detailed_translations.english: a level on a scale that shows how good, important, popular etc someone or something is

sentences.english: Children’s TV nowadays is much more entertaining.
sentences.chinese: 如今的儿童电视节目要比过去有趣多了。

sentences.english: an entertaining evening
sentences.chinese: 令人愉快的夜晚

detailed_translations.english: amusing and interesting

sentences.english: the news on Channel 4
sentences.chinese: 第四频道播出的新闻

sentences.english: The kids are watching cartoons on the Disney Channel.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们在看迪士尼频道的卡通片。

sentences.english: What channel is ‘ER’ on?
sentences.chinese: 《仁心仁术》在哪个频道播放？

sentences.english: He changed channels to watch the basketball game.
sentences.chinese: 他转换频道看篮球比赛。

detailed_translations.english: a television station and all the programmes that it broadcasts

detailed_translations.chinese: 把〔钱、精力等〕导向〔特定目的〕；引导；把…用于
detailed_translations.english: to control and direct something such as money or energy towards a particular purpose

sentences.english: Our top priorities must be profit and commercial growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须把利润和贸易增长作为我们的第一要务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 商业的， 商务的； 商品化的， 商业性的
detailed_translations.english: related to business and the buying and selling of goods and services

name: complex
trans: 复杂的, 难懂的, 费解的

sentences.english: a complex system of highways
sentences.chinese: 复杂的公路网

sentences.english: Photosynthesis is a highly complex process.
sentences.chinese: 光合作用是一个非常复杂的过程。

sentences.english: Peter seemed to have an instant understanding of the most complex issues.
sentences.chinese: 再复杂的问题彼得似乎也是一看就明白。

sentences.english: It was a very complex relationship between two complex people.
sentences.chinese: 这是两个复杂的人之间非常复杂的关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由许多部分组成的，复合的；复杂的，难懂的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of many different parts and often difficult to understand

detailed_translations.chinese: 综合体， 集合体； 情结， 夸大的情绪反应
detailed_translations.english: a group of buildings, or a large building with many parts, used for a particular purpose

sentences.english: a boring movie full of bad dialog
sentences.chinese: 充满差劲对白的乏味电影

sentences.english: Students were asked to read simple dialogues out loud.
sentences.chinese: 学生被要求大声朗读简单的对话。

detailed_translations.english: a conversation in a book, play, or film

sentences.english: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 我可以全心全意地支持他们的观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
detailed_translations.english: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

sentences.english: I'd like to try and forget the whole episode.
sentences.chinese: 我倒想尽量把那段经历全部忘掉。

sentences.english: One of the funniest episodes in the book occurs in Chapter 6.
sentences.chinese: 书中最有趣的片段之一在第6章。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人生的）一段经历；（小说的）片段，插曲
detailed_translations.english: an event, a situation, or a period of time in sb's life, a novel, etc. that is important or interesting in some way

sentences.english: The crowd parted to let the truck pass.
sentences.chinese: 人群分开让卡车通过。

sentences.english: He gave me a smile as he passed.
sentences.chinese: 他经过时对我微笑了一下。

sentences.english: We passed a group of students outside the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我们在戏院外从一群学生身旁经过。

sentences.english: I pass the sports centre on the way to work.
sentences.chinese: 我上班的路上经过体育中心。

sentences.english: The road passes right through the town centre.
sentences.chinese: 那条路正好穿过镇中心。

sentences.english: We passed the winter pleasantly enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们相当愉快地度过了那个冬季。

detailed_translations.english: to come up to a particular place, person, or object and go past them

name: PhD
trans: 哲学博士学位; 博士学位

sentences.english: Proponents of the PhD argue that it is worthwhile even if it does not lead to permanent academic employment.
sentences.chinese: 支持者争辩说，即使找不到终身从事学术研究的工作，攻读博士学位也是值得的。

sentences.english: Firstly, you have to get a PhD, but if you want to practise you then need venture capital, otherwise you don't have the tools.
sentences.chinese: 首先，你必须弄到一个哲学博士学位，但是如果你想执业的话还要有创业资本。 要不然你就拿不到仪器。

detailed_translations.chinese: 博士学位；哲学博士学位（Doctor of Philosophy）

name: primary
trans: 首要的, 主要的, 初级的, 根本的

sentences.english: Our primary concern is to provide the refugees with food and health care.
sentences.chinese: 我们的头等大事是向难民提供食品和医疗。

sentences.english: Many of the villagers rely on fishing as their primary source of income.
sentences.chinese: 很多村民以打鱼作为他们的主要收入来源。

sentences.english: Personal safety is of primary importance .
sentences.chinese: 人身安全至关重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 首要的， 主要的； 基本的； 最初的， 初级的
detailed_translations.english: most important

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

name: public
trans: 公众的, 公用的, 公共的

sentences.english: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。

sentences.english: full public access to information
sentences.chinese: 公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.english: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.chinese: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.english: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.chinese: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.english: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.english: He is adored by his public.
sentences.chinese: 他深受支持者喜爱。

detailed_translations.english: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

sentences.english: He left school without any qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 他离校时没有拿到任何文凭。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a qualification, you have passed an examination or course to show you have a particular level of skill or knowledge in a subject

name: college
trans: 学院, 大学, 高等专科学校

sentences.english: a teacher training college
sentences.chinese: 师范学院

sentences.english: Donna left school and went to art college.
sentences.chinese: 唐娜中学毕业后进了艺术学院。

sentences.english: Some people who want to go to college still can’t get there.
sentences.chinese: 有些想上大学的人仍然无法如愿。

detailed_translations.english: a school for advanced education, especially in a particular profession or skill

sentences.english: He teaches Esperanto at that university.
sentences.chinese: 他在那所大学教世界语。

sentences.english: She buddied up with a student from another university.
sentences.chinese: 她与来自另一大学的一名学生交朋友。

sentences.english: The student left the university to go out into the world and find himself.
sentences.chinese: 这个学生离开了大学进入社会去发现自己的才能所在。

detailed_translations.english: an educational institution at the highest level, where you study for a degree

sentences.english: the elementary principles of justice and democracy
sentences.chinese: 正义和民主的基本信条

sentences.english: You’ve made a very elementary mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个非常基本的错误。

sentences.english: I’m only familiar with the subject at an elementary level.
sentences.chinese: 我对这门学科的了解只是初级水平。

detailed_translations.english: simple or basic

sentences.english: Newspapers vary in the degree to which they emphasize propaganda rather than information.
sentences.chinese: 报纸重宣传轻资讯的程度各不相同。

detailed_translations.english: the level or amount of something

sentences.english: Susan Potter, BA
sentences.chinese: 苏珊·波特，文学士

detailed_translations.english: a first university  degree  in a subject such as history, languages, or English literature

sentences.english: birth/death/marriage certificate (=giving details of someone’s birth, death, or marriage)
sentences.chinese: 出生/死亡/结婚证书

sentences.english: a degree certificate
sentences.chinese: 学位证书

detailed_translations.chinese: 证书，证件，执照；（毕业）文凭，合格证书
detailed_translations.english: an official document that states that a fact or facts are true

sentences.english: Your goal as a parent is to help your child become an independent adult.
sentences.chinese: 身为父母，你的目标就是要培养孩子成为独立的成年人。

sentences.english: be in goal/keep goal (=be the goalkeeper)
sentences.chinese: 守球门

sentences.english: I scored the first goal.
sentences.chinese: 我踢进了第一个球。

detailed_translations.english: something that you hope to achieve in the future

name: cost
trans: 费用, 花费, 开销

sentences.english: I offered to pay the cost of the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 我提出支付出租车费。

sentences.english: Insurance to cover the cost of a funeral is possible.
sentences.chinese: 可以用保险支付葬礼费用。

sentences.english: This doesn’t include the cost of repairing the damage.
sentences.chinese: 这不包括修理破损的费用。

sentences.english: the terrible cost of the war in death and suffering
sentences.chinese: 这场战争造成的死亡与苦难的惨重代价

sentences.english: low cost housing
sentences.chinese: 低成本住宅

sentences.english: the high cost of production
sentences.chinese: 很高的生产成本

sentences.english: A cassette/radio is included at no extra cost .
sentences.chinese: 附送一台卡式收录机。

sentences.english: The funds will just cover the museum’s running costs .
sentences.chinese: 这些资金只够支付博物馆的运转费用。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you have to pay in order to buy, do, or produce something

name: location
trans: 位置, 场所, 所在地

sentences.english: The main problem for engineers was the location of underground rivers in the area.
sentences.chinese: 工程师们面临的主要难题是要确定该地区地下河的位置。

detailed_translations.english: the act of finding the position of something

sentences.english: Alice Munro has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯•门罗有文风抑郁的名声。

detailed_translations.english: the opinion that people have about someone or something because of what has happened in the past

name: recommendation
trans: 推荐; 劝告, 建议

sentences.english: Academic staff are appointed on the recommendation of a committee.
sentences.chinese: 教员是委员会推荐任命的。

sentences.english: We will review the case and make a recommendation to the client.
sentences.chinese: 我们将审查此案，然后向当事人提出建议。

detailed_translations.english: a suggestion to someone that they should choose a particular thing or person that you think is very good

name: advantage
trans: 优势, 好处, 优点

sentences.english: Younger workers tend to be at an advantage (=  have an advantage  ) when applying for jobs.
sentences.chinese: 年轻点的工人申请工作时往往处于优势地位。

sentences.english: One of the many advantages of living in New York is that you can eat out at almost any time of day.
sentences.chinese: 住在纽约的诸多好处之一是几乎任何时候都可以外出吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps you to be more successful than others, or the state of having this

sentences.english: The current trend is towards more part-time employment.
sentences.chinese: 当前的趋势是雇用更多的兼职人员。

sentences.english: the general trend towards the centralization of political power
sentences.chinese: 政治权力集中化的普遍趋势

sentences.english: A disturbing trend is that victims of violence are getting younger.
sentences.chinese: 一个令人担心的趋势是，暴力行为的受害者越来越年轻。

sentences.english: The growing trend is for single mothers to bring up children by themselves.
sentences.chinese: 单身母亲独自抚养孩子的趋势在上升。

sentences.english: Even so, the underlying trend is positive.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，基本趋势仍是乐观的。

sentences.english: national and international economic trends
sentences.chinese: 国内和国际的经济趋势

sentences.english: the downward trend in the price of gold
sentences.chinese: 黄金价格的下滑势头

sentences.english: Successive presidents have tried to reverse this trend , but without success.
sentences.chinese: 连续几任总统都试图扭转这一趋势，但均未成功。

detailed_translations.english: a general tendency in the way a situation is changing or developing

sentences.english: Professor Lanphier obtained his doctorate in social psychology from the University of Michigan.
sentences.chinese: 兰菲尔教授从密歇根大学获得了社会心理学博士学位。

detailed_translations.english: a university degree of the highest level

sentences.english: It looks likely that the peace talks will fail.
sentences.chinese: 看来和平谈判可能会失败。

sentences.english: Millions of people have tried to quit smoking and failed miserably (= been completely unsuccessful ).
sentences.chinese: 数百万人戒过烟，都以惨败告终。

sentences.english: his efforts to save his failing marriage
sentences.chinese: 他挽救自己濒危婚姻的努力

sentences.english: The brakes on my bike failed half way down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 我骑自行车下山到中途刹车失灵了。

detailed_translations.english: to not succeed in achieving something

sentences.english: a driving instructor
sentences.chinese: 驾驶教练

sentences.english: ski instructors
sentences.chinese: 滑雪教练

detailed_translations.english: someone who teaches a sport or practical skill

sentences.english: He lives just across the street from me.
sentences.chinese: 他就住在我街对面。

sentences.english: We live only a few miles from the coast.
sentences.chinese: 我们住的地方离海边只有几英里远。

sentences.english: A rather odd family came tolive next door to us.
sentences.chinese: 有一户相当奇怪的人家搬到了我们隔壁。

sentences.english: As soon as I saw the place, I knew I didn’t want to live there.
sentences.chinese: 我一看到那地方，就觉得不想住在那儿。

sentences.english: Does Paul stilllive here?
sentences.chinese: 保罗还住在这儿吗？

sentences.english: We’re still looking for somewhere to live.
sentences.chinese: 我们还在找住的地方。

sentences.english: They’ve finally found a place to live.
sentences.chinese: 他们终于找到了住的地方。

sentences.english: Most seventeen-year-olds still live at home(= live with their parents ).
sentences.chinese: 17 岁的孩子大都还住在家里。

sentences.english: I’m quite happy living alone.
sentences.chinese: 我一个人住很开心。

sentences.english: The house has 3,600 square feet of living space(= the areas of a house you live in ).
sentences.chinese: 这房子有3,600平方英尺的居住空间。

detailed_translations.english: if you live in a place, you have your home there
not dead or artificial

sentences.english: Heart disease is one of the commonest causes of death.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病是最常见的死因之一。

sentences.english: They share a common interest in photography.
sentences.chinese: 他们在摄影方面兴趣相投。

detailed_translations.english: happening often and to many people or in many places

sentences.english: Was my name mentioned at all?
sentences.chinese: 我的名字被提到过吗？

sentences.english: Some of the problems were mentioned in his report.
sentences.chinese: 其中的一些问题在他的报告里提到了。

sentences.english: (= it is important enough to mention ) that they only studied a very small number of cases.
sentences.chinese: 必须说明的是他们仅研究了几个个案。

sentences.english: As I mentioned earlier , there have been a lot of changes recently.
sentences.chinese: 正如我刚才所说的，最近变化很大。

sentences.english: She mentioned in passing (= mentioned in a quick unimportant way ) that you had just been to Rome.
sentences.chinese: 她只是随口提了一下你刚刚去过罗马。

sentences.english: They all get a mention (= they are all mentioned ) in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他们在书中全都被提到了。

detailed_translations.english: to talk or write about something or someone, usually quickly and without saying very much or giving details
when someone mentions something or someone in a conversation, piece of writing etc

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

name: leave
trans: 辞去(工作等), 脱离(组织等), 离开(家)

sentences.english: My baby gets upset when I leave the room.
sentences.chinese: 我一离开房间宝宝就会不安。

sentences.english: Before leaving the train, make sure you have all your belongings with you.
sentences.chinese: 下火车前一定要带好随身物品。

sentences.english: Leave the motorway at Junction 7.
sentences.chinese: 请在七号交叉路口驶离高速公路。

sentences.english: My youngest boy has not left my side (= has stayed near me ) since his daddy was killed.
sentences.chinese: 我最小的儿子自从他爸爸死后就没有离开过我的身边。

detailed_translations.english: to go away from a place or a person
to go away from a place or a person

name: join
trans: 加入, 参加, 成为...的一员

sentences.english: Many sacrificed their weekend to join the hunt for the missing girl.
sentences.chinese: 许多人牺牲周末时间，加入了寻找失踪女孩的行动。

sentences.english: the benefits of joining our pension scheme
sentences.chinese: 参加我们的退休金计划的好处

sentences.english: Church leaders have joined the campaign to end foxhunting.
sentences.chinese: 教会领袖参与了禁止猎狐的运动。

sentences.english: Join the two pieces of wood with strong glue.
sentences.chinese: 用强力胶水把两块木头黏合起来。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to take part in an activity that other people are involved in

name: quit
trans: 辞职, 离开, 放弃

sentences.english: He quit his job after an argument with a colleague.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个同事争吵后就辞职了。

sentences.english: I quit school at 16.
sentences.chinese: 我十六岁辍学。

sentences.english: She has decided to quit show business.
sentences.chinese: 她已决定退出娱乐圈。

sentences.english: People are now calling on the chairman to quit.
sentences.chinese: 人们现在正要求主席辞职。

sentences.english: I've quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 我戒了烟。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely

name: move
trans: 搬家, 迁移, 调遣, 调动

sentences.english: Please keep the doors closed while the train is moving.
sentences.chinese: 火车行驶时请保持车门关闭。

sentences.english: ‘Come on,’ Sue said. No one moved.
sentences.chinese: “来吧。”休说。但没有人动。

sentences.english: Could you move your car, please? It’s blocking the road.
sentences.chinese: 你能把车挪一下吗？挡着路了。

sentences.english: Becca moved down the steps and into the yard.
sentences.chinese: 贝卡走下台阶，来到院子里。

sentences.english: The bar was so crowded you could hardly move .
sentences.chinese: 酒吧很挤，人都难以挪动。

sentences.english: His speech moved the audience to tears.
sentences.chinese: 他的演讲让听众感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He made no move to come any nearer.
sentences.chinese: 他没有再靠近。

detailed_translations.english: to change from one place or position to another, or to make something do this
when someone moves for a short time in a particular direction

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

name: expand
trans: 扩大, 扩张, 扩大

sentences.english: Water expands as it freezes.
sentences.chinese: 水结冰时会膨胀。

sentences.english: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.english: exercises that expand the chest muscles
sentences.chinese: 扩展胸肌的运动

sentences.english: his expanding waistline
sentences.chinese: 他那逐渐增大的腰围

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

sentences.english: American manufacturing organizations have been downsizing their factories.
sentences.chinese: 美国制造商们一直在缩小他们工厂的规模。

sentences.english: ...today's downsized economy.
sentences.chinese: … 今天萎缩了的经济。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩小尺寸； 缩小规模
detailed_translations.english: To downsize something such as a business or industry means to make it smaller

sentences.english: a confidential government report
sentences.chinese: 一份机密的政府报告

sentences.english: Doctors are required to keep patients’ records completely confidential .
sentences.chinese: 医生必须对病人的病历完全保密。

sentences.english: The information will be regarded as strictly confidential (= completely confidential ) .
sentences.chinese: 这一信息将被视为绝对机密。

detailed_translations.english: spoken or written in secret and intended to be kept secret

name: suppose
trans: 推想, 猜想, 假设

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

name: intranet
trans: (国际互连网的企业)内部网(络)

sentences.english: ...a slide projector.
sentences.chinese: …幻灯机。

detailed_translations.chinese: [仪] 投影仪；放映机；探照灯；设计者
detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a film or picture appear on a screen or flat surface

sentences.english: customer details held on a database
sentences.chinese: 存储在数据库内的客户详细信息

detailed_translations.english: a large amount of data stored in a computer system so that you can find and use it easily

sentences.english: One more hack and the branch was off.
sentences.chinese: 又砍了一下树枝就掉下来了。

detailed_translations.english: a taxi, or a taxi driver
to cut something roughly or violently

sentences.english: All the cars are tested for defects before they leave the factory.
sentences.chinese: 所有汽车在出厂前都经过品质检验。

sentences.english: a genetic defect
sentences.chinese: 遗传缺陷

detailed_translations.english: a fault or a lack of something that means that something or someone is not perfect
to leave your own country or group in order to go to or join an opposing one

name: major
trans: 重要的, 主要的, 较大的

sentences.english: There are two major political parties in the US.
sentences.chinese: 美国有两大政党。

sentences.english: The government’s major concern is with preventing road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 政府关注的大事是预防道路交通事故。

sentences.english: Smoking is one of the major causes of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟是引发癌症的元凶之一。

sentences.english: the major developments in computer technology
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术的重大进步

sentences.english: He’s majoring in Political Science.
sentences.chinese: 他主修政治学。

detailed_translations.english: very large or important, when compared to other things or people of a similar kind
to study something as your main subject at college or university

sentences.english: We aim to offer good value and service to all our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求为所有的客户提供物有所值的商品和服务。

sentences.english: We’ve had several letters from satisfied customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了几封顾客表示满意的来信。

sentences.english: He’s one of our regular customers .
sentences.chinese: 他是我们的一个老主顾。

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys goods or services from a shop, company etc

name: steal
trans: 偷窃, 偷盗, 窃取

sentences.english: Boys broke into a shop and stole £45 in cash.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们闯进一家商店，盗走了45英镑现金。

detailed_translations.english: to take something that belongs to someone else
to be very cheap

sentences.english: I need more information.
sentences.chinese: 我需要更多信息。

detailed_translations.english: facts or details that tell you something about a situation, person, event etc

sentences.english: The London factory assembles the finished product .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦工厂组装成品。

sentences.english: He works in marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 他从事营销和产品开发。

sentences.english: Paula was the product of a sheltered middle-class home.
sentences.chinese: 葆拉是备受呵护的中产阶级家庭的产物。

sentences.english: The product of 21 and 16 is 336.

detailed_translations.english: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

sentences.english: They would inform him of any progress they had made.
sentences.chinese: 他们将把自己所取得的任何进展都告诉他。

sentences.english: My daughter informed me that she was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我女儿告诉我她怀孕了。

detailed_translations.english: If you inform someone of something, you tell them about it
to officially tell someone about something or give them information

sentences.english: The body was discovered in a field.
sentences.chinese: 尸体是在一块田地里找到的。

sentences.english: Forest Service crews often discover campfires that have not been put out completely.
sentences.chinese: 林务局工作人员常常发现未完全熄灭的营火。

detailed_translations.english: to find someone or something, either by accident or because you were looking for them

sentences.english: My attention wasn’t really on the game.
sentences.chinese: 我的注意力其实不在比赛上。

sentences.english: She tried to pay attention to what he was saying.
sentences.chinese: 她尽量注意听他说话。

sentences.english: If you paid more attention in class, you might actually learn something!
sentences.chinese: 要是你上课更认真些，也许能实实在在地学到些东西！

sentences.english: Scott sat down at his desk and turned his attention to the file he had in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 斯科特在自己的办公桌前坐下，将注意力转向面前的文件。

sentences.english: As a society we need to give more attention to the needs of older people.
sentences.chinese: 生活在同一社会里，我们得更加关注长者的需求。

sentences.english: Now he’s gone, I can give you my undivided attention .
sentences.chinese: 现在他已经走了，我可以把全部注意力都放在你身上。

sentences.english: This game is fun and is sure to keep the attention of any young student.
sentences.chinese: 这个游戏很有趣，一定能使年幼学生保持注意力。

sentences.english: They listened to the speech with close attention .
sentences.chinese: 他们很认真地听演讲。

sentences.english: Attention to detail is essential in this job.
sentences.chinese: 关注细节是这份工作所必需的。

sentences.english: During the lecture Sarah’s attention began to wander .
sentences.chinese: 上课时，萨拉开始走神了。

detailed_translations.english: when you carefully listen to, look at, or think about someone or something

name: severe
trans: 严重的, 非常恶劣的

sentences.english: His injuries were quite severe.
sentences.chinese: 他的伤势很严重。

sentences.english: She’s suffering from severe depression.
sentences.chinese: 她患有严重的抑郁症。

sentences.english: The US faces severe economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 美国面临严重的经济问题。

sentences.english: The storm caused severe damage.
sentences.chinese: 这场暴风雨造成了严重的破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 严重的； 严厉的， 严格的； 严峻的， 艰难的； 朴素的， 不加装饰的
detailed_translations.english: severe problems, injuries, illnesses etc are very bad or very serious

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

sentences.english: He was moved by her obvious concern.
sentences.chinese: 她明显的关心使他感动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关切的事，有关的事；关心，挂念；关系，关联；公司，企业
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of wanting someone to be happy and healthy

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及， 有关； 使关心， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: if a story, book, report etc concerns someone or something, it is about them

sentences.english: Such schemes mean little unless they impact people.
sentences.chinese: 除非能对人们造成影响，否则这样的计划意义不大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 影响， 作用， 冲击
detailed_translations.english: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

sentences.english: the areas affected by the hurricane
sentences.chinese: 受飓风影响的地区

sentences.english: a disease that affects the central nervous system
sentences.chinese: 影响中枢神经系统的疾病

sentences.english: decisions which affect our lives
sentences.chinese: 影响我们生活的决定

sentences.english: Trading has been adversely affected by the downturn in consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 贸易受到消费支出回落的不利影响。

sentences.english: We were all deeply affected by her death.
sentences.chinese: 我们都为她的去世深感悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that produces an effect or change in something or in someone’s situation
